primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The reduction of complex dogma to the 'banal' essence of love as the only necessary reality for human existence and social structure.

tekstueel_bewijs: versuchen, unser Leben so zu bauen, dass es mit diesem Satz übereinstimmt
wir werden versuchen... den Kern neu zu entfalten
dass wir uns gegenseitig lieben sollen
Die Botschaft des Evangeliums... sagt nichts anderes als: dass wir uns gegenseitig lieben sollen
den Satz, den die Beatles singen: »All you need is love.« Das ist das Evangelium

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Neighbor (specifically the Third World)
tekstueel_bewijs: fünf Prozent des Einkommens der Kirchen für die Hungernden zu geben
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who must perform love.

tekstueel_bewijs: Gott ist die Kraft, das Feuer, das unsere Liebe trägt
helper.rol_van_god: God is instrumentalized as a 'Helper' (Adjuvant) to the human Subject's capacity to love.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power redefined as psychological/vitalist energy.

tekstueel_bewijs: Zerrüttet durch eine Sprache, die wir nicht verstehen
Angst, dass es uns überfordern... könnte
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not Sin or Death, but rather the psychological weight of traditional religious structures and the fear of being overwhelmed.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Political activism as the realization of 'Eternal Life'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian Citizen / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon collapses the primary (soteriological) into the secondary (ethical). Eternal life is redefined as the success of the secondary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott ist, dass wir lieben können
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir sollten aufhören, Gott zu suchen

voorbeelden: dass wir uns gegenseitig lieben sollen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'ability' (Pouvoir) of the human subject to act once the 'burden' of dogma is removed. It is a theology of human potentiality.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Dogma) to ~S2 (Banal Gospel) to S1 (Love).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by discarding the vertical dimension entirely in favor of the horizontal.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Judgment/Dogma) is treated as a linguistic obstacle rather than a divine reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the rejection of 'commands', the sermon is radically anthropocentric. God is reduced to a predicate of human action ('God is, that we can love').

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Das ewige Leben entscheidet sich hier bei uns, an keiner anderen Stelle.
Das, was immer wieder »Gott« genannt wird... brauchen wir nicht für unser Leben.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Liebe bedarf keiner Rechtfertigung... Sie rechtfertigt sich aus sich selbst.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not a Savior but a model who addressed the heart instead of the Super-Ego.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the one who loves where we cannot, whose love is the source rather than the goal.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent within its own secular-humanist framework, but incoherent as a Christian sermon.
spanning_punten: The claim that 'God is love' while simultaneously stating 'we don't need God'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christus hat gesagt, das ewige Du sei im irdischen Du.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Spirit' is replaced by the 'fire' of human love.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'closing the heart' or 'capitalist greed', solvable by political will.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a secular call to action where God is an adjective for human capacity.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Man is the subject of 'loving', 'building', and 'deciding eternal life'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the Subject who loves the unlovable, enabling the human to receive.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'God is that we can love', use 'Because God loved us first, we are freed from ourselves to see the neighbor'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero of the Third World's salvation.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the one who 'closes the heart' and needs a Savior before they can be a helper.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Introduce Devoir (Divine Law) to expose inability, then Grace as the new Pouvoir.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Acknowledge that we *cannot* love as we should.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify Sin as a power that prevents love despite our best intentions.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the 'Helper' (God) becomes unnecessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God's love for the sinner (Soteriology) -> 2. The sinner's love for the neighbor (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a classic example of 'Horizontalism' where the Gospel is lost in translation to sociology.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is persuasive and 'modern'; semiotically, it is a complete departure from theistic narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would find 1 John 4:19 ('We love because He first loved us') which contradicts the sermon's 'God is that we can love'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Love' here is not a gift received but a performance executed by the human subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Gospel' as a synonym for 'Humanism'.
